intro: Dichapetalum howii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. Dichapetalum howii is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows.
